Claimable

attributes.documentation: @dev Modifier throws if called by any account other than the pendingOwner.
attributes.name: onlyPendingOwner

attributes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to set the pendingOwner address.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
attributes.name: transferOwnership

attributes.documentation: @dev Allows the pendingOwner address to finalize the transfer.
attributes.name: claimOwnership
HasNoEther

attributes.documentation:
@dev Constructor that rejects incoming Ether
The `payable` flag is added so we can access `msg.value` without compiler warning. If we
leave out payable, then Solidity will allow inheriting contracts to implement a payable
constructor. By doing it this way we prevent a payable constructor from working. Alternatively
we could use assembly to access msg.value.
@dev Disallows direct send by settings a default function without the `payable` flag.
@dev Transfer all Ether held by the contract to the owner.
attributes.name: reclaimEther
HasNoContracts

attributes.documentation:
@dev Reclaim ownership of Ownable contracts
@param contractAddr The address of the Ownable to be reclaimed.
attributes.name: reclaimContract
CanReclaimToken

attributes.documentation:
@dev Reclaim all ERC20Basic compatible tokens
@param token ERC20Basic The address of the token contract
attributes.name: reclaimToken
HasNoTokens
tokenFallback
NoOwner

attributes.documentation:
@title Destructible
@dev Base contract that can be destroyed by owner. All funds in contract will be sent to the owner.
attributes.name: Destructible

attributes.documentation: @dev Transfers the current balance to the owner and terminates the contract.
